intro: Epicampes ebrenhergii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
